pageContext.claim: “And you look at those bad numbers that were there in the last couple of years, it was this way, and going in the wrong direction. It was the weakest recovery in the history of our country since, I guess, to be totally specific, because I'm not sure they've gone any further, since the Great Depression, in '20s, it was the weakest recovery we've ever had. It was barely a recovery.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump routinely tries to take credit for jobs created since the election, even though Obama was still president, yet here he calls economic growth in the first quarter of his presidency "Obama's last quarter." Moreover, Trump falsely claims "we were headed down" when in fact he inherited an economy that already had the longest period of unbroken job growth in U.S. history.
